fullText: The show has moments of genuine power, particularly in its second act, when the rise of Nazism begins to tear apart both the group and the society that embraced them.
dtliExcerpt: Timely it may sadly be, but a theatrical triumph it still isnâ€™t. I reviewed the show back in 1997, and while it is changed and improved, it rarely rises above a level of admirable, hard-working professionalism.
